channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: "Break My Soul," the lead single from Beyoncé’s new album "Renaissance," features the superstar's 20th top 10 hit on the Billboard Hot 100 chart as a solo artist https://t.co/RhbvLLbNdR

Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis has taken aim at what he calls “woke capital” and the environmental, social and corporate governance movement, proposing actions to blunt what he described as “ideological corporate power” https://t.co/ew1SeBt0Xl
If a salesman wants to convince people to buy what he’s selling, it helps if he has a beard, according to a study https://t.co/CxgngXydcL
The House passed a $280 billion bill aimed at boosting U.S. chip production, sending it to President Biden for his signature https://t.co/TW6UurCiba

The makers of Coca-Cola, Dove shampoo, Huggies diapers and other global brands said they would keep raising consumer prices to cover the impact of inflation on their running costs #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/a6hJhrvRVy https://t.co/NoRH1GMbMz
Sprite is retiring its signature green bottle, which it has used for more than six decades, and will instead use clear bottles that are supposed to be more sustainable https://t.co/6cyOIynOjN

Instagram’s push to prioritize creators and video over friends and photos has changed the user experience. And many of those users aren’t happy. If you are annoyed by the changes to the feed, there are steps that might help. https://t.co/9Yi734sWWE

Indigenous groups fought for decades to protect Canadian rainforests. This spring, they had a double victory: Logging was stopped and a major timber company agreed to pay them millions of dollars to protect trees left standing. https://t.co/twgd3eMQRL

Jack Ma plans to cede control of Ant Group, people familiar with the matter said, as the Chinese fintech giant moves away from Alibaba after a year of tough regulatory pressure https://t.co/oI9ka0F7p4
Short-term government-bond yields declined after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 0.75 percentage point at its July meeting https://t.co/NgfXhGUCik
Wuhan, the central Chinese city that was the epicenter of the early Covid-19 outbreak, has locked down a district of about 1 million people due to four asymptomatic cases https://t.co/qGjiP0PLA9
The U.S. economy shrank at a 0.9% annual rate last quarter. That marks a second straight quarterly decline in GDP—a common definition of recession. https://t.co/RC7swzQ6Qe
JetBlue reached a deal to buy Spirit for $3.8 billion, creating the fifth-largest U.S. carrier after a fierce bidding war with Frontier https://t.co/63gjYsT2wi
JetBlue is nearing a deal to buy Spirit, according to people familiar with the matter https://t.co/79A901Yn3m
Two more HIV patients appear to have beaten their infections, giving clues to scientists trying to cure the virus that causes AIDS https://t.co/RuskSwP5f7

BASF, one of the world’s largest chemicals companies, will cut its production of a key fertilizer ingredient as it seeks to curb its natural gas use, in a move that could have ramifications for the global food crisis https://t.co/UAXMNxY9w2
The Senate has approved a $280 billion bill aimed at boosting the semiconductor industry to counter China https://t.co/y7UxsBvis8

The U.S. sought to free Brittney Griner and another American, Paul Whelan, from Russian detention with an offer to release Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout, people familiar with the matter said, but the overture has not been accepted https://t.co/NYDH1PJhGy
The Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 0.75 percentage point and signaled more rises are coming to fight inflation #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/gBFxk8aIFN https://t.co/jJPakqvAeX
Breaking: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 0.75 percentage point, the fourth consecutive increase aimed at combating high inflation https://t.co/FkJTvnhlke
A $280 billion bill to encourage chip research and manufacturing in the U.S. has passed the Senate. It is expected to see quick action in the House. https://t.co/Et8ZqiQf9R

Wuhan, the central Chinese city that was the epicenter of the early Covid-19 outbreak, locked down a district of about 1 million people due to four asymptomatic cases, as the nation’s leaders maintain their zero tolerance toward the virus https://t.co/UvphHuI3Zk

Russian-installed authorities suspended traffic along a key bridge in southern Ukraine and prepared their defenses after Ukrainian forces stepped up attacks on infrastructure that Moscow needs https://t.co/Xu7O7vHdrN
Breaking: Two more HIV patients appear to have beaten their infections, giving clues to scientists trying to cure the virus that causes AIDS https://t.co/Baw3qmQ33l

More than $1 billion is on the line for the next Mega Millions lottery drawing on Friday, the third-highest Mega Millions jackpot ever, lottery officials said. Tickets cost $2 and the odds of winning are around 1 in 302 million. https://t.co/JGo2HcvQAg

BASF, one of the world’s largest chemicals companies, will cut its production of a key fertilizer ingredient as it seeks to curb its natural gas use, in a move that could have ramifications for the global food crisis https://t.co/DSPYWRgOPr
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/eAoBIUzuXM
Chris Cuomo is joining the prime-time lineup of Nexstar’s fledgling cable-TV news network NewsNation as a host, less than a year after being fired by CNN https://t.co/qssLBePotA
The Senate voted 64 to 32 Tuesday to advance a $280 billion package of subsidies and research funding to boost U.S. competitiveness in semiconductors and advanced technology https://t.co/iIlluEUKHo
Brad Pitt has paid $40 million for a roughly century-old home on a bluff in the Carmel Highlands along California’s central coast https://t.co/ojf2OLmghd
GM's profit fell 40%, hurt by a loss in China and supply-chain troubles that left it with tens of thousands of unfinished vehicles https://t.co/nNCrAxHtzk
Russian gas flows to Germany through the Nord Stream pipeline will drop to about 20% of capacity, Gazprom said, blaming turbine problems https://t.co/4axIshFkis

Russia said it will withdraw from the International Space Station after 2024, a decision that comes after months of tension between the country and its international partners that run the orbiting research facility https://t.co/Xltig4Kpal
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/71a7d7HLLa
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/gNFKEUN8gy
Japan executed a man convicted of killing seven people in 2008 when he rammed a truck into a Tokyo crowd and went on a stabbing spree https://t.co/3HYPrpVWsy
China tried to build a network of informants inside the Federal Reserve system and even detained a Fed economist, according to a report by Senate Republicans https://t.co/jofPYYynfd

A former Goldman Sachs vice president was charged in an insider-trading scheme in which he allegedly profited by tipping off a close friend to confidential information about coming mergers and acquisitions connected to the bank https://t.co/Oy0qHqUIv6
Brad Pitt has paid $40 million for a roughly century-old home on a bluff in the Carmel Highlands along California’s central coast https://t.co/opfrT7TUHK
Walmart cut its profit outlook, warning that higher food and gas prices are causing consumers to pull back. Shares fell 8% after hours. https://t.co/JZjvmIibGp
Most of the nation’s hospitals receive big tax breaks in return for giving people a break on their bills. They’re not very generous. https://t.co/Ca2SItTITT
Russia calls on Ukraine to resume grain shipments, despite its attack on the key port of Odessa over the weekend https://t.co/PuYztpHfDV
Samantha Bee is the latest casualty of the cost-cutting at Warner Bros. Discovery, as the company shuts down her political humor show https://t.co/pubTvsm4bL

New investigations by the SEC and federal prosecutors into hush-money payments made by WWE’s Vince McMahon to settle allegations of sexual misconduct hastened his retirement as chief executive, according to people familiar with the matter https://t.co/WDijh8uMD4

A former Goldman Sachs vice president was charged in an insider-trading scheme in which he allegedly profited by tipping off a close friend to confidential information about coming mergers and acquisitions connected to the bank https://t.co/Ui2JdwLTWL

The U.S. Department of Energy said it will loan to a General Motors joint venture $2.5 billion to fund construction of three battery cell factories, part of the Biden Administration’s plans to jumpstart the market for electric cars https://t.co/Ni0gMYgwck

Thousands in California were evacuated, critical infrastructure was under threat and power outages were reported as the Oak Fire burned near Yosemite National Park #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/onbrtPcJcd https://t.co/jrhSSk9VzE
Russian gas flows to Germany through the Nord Stream pipeline will drop to about 20% of capacity, Gazprom said, blaming turbine problems https://t.co/uvTw6yLbq5

Disney+ began streaming R-rated movies—“Deadpool,” “Deadpool 2” and “Logan”—for the first time on Friday, as it pushes further into adult-focused content in pursuit of new subscribers https://t.co/zY5vZ048gu

China is leading the world in building new chip factories in a self-sufficiency push that could eventually make some buyers reliant on the country for many of the basic chips now in short supply https://t.co/KMo2JfchKL
